ground_truth: She snaps the bag shut. He breaks off as a short, squatty woman, pushing a child in a walker, comes into sight and approaches. She stops beside Neff, who is pretending to read a label on a can. Phyllis puts a few cakes of soap into her basket. She nods. Neff reaches a can down from the high shelf and hands it to her. She moves away with her coffee and her child. Out of the corner of his eye Neff watches her go. He moves closer to Phyllis again. He goes off. She stares after him. He is wearing a light grey suit and has his hat on. He is standing behind his desk opening some mail, taking a few papers out of his briefcase, checking something in his rate book, making a quick telephone call. Keyes enters with some papers in his hand. The telephone rings on Neff's desk. Automatically Keyes grabs the phone and answers. Neff picks the phone up and answers. Phyllis is on the phone. Neff on the phone. His eye catches Keyes', who is walking up and down. He speaks into the phone as calmly as possible. Neff on phone. He covers the receiver with his hand and turns to Keyes, who is now standing at the window. He makes a gesture as if expecting Keyes to leave. Keyes stays right where he is. Neff looks at Keyes' back with a strained expression, then lifts the phone again. Neff on the phone. Neff gets up from his desk. He punches his stomach with his fist. Keyes nods slowly, a little sad and a little ashamed. He goes out. Neff is alone. He watches the door close, then turns and goes slowly to the water cooler. He fills a paper cup and stands holding it. His thoughts are somewhere else. After a moment he absently throws the cupful of water into the receptacle under the cooler. He goes back to the desk. He takes his rate book out of his brief case and puts it on the desk. He leaves the office, with his briefcase under his arm. Neff's coupe comes down the street and swings into the garage and goes down the ramp into the basement. There are about eight cars parked. A colored attendant in coveralls and rubber boots is washing a car with a hose and sponge. Neff's car comes into the shot and stops near the attendant. Neff gets out with his briefcase under his arm. He is folding a hand towel and stuffing it into his jacket pocket. He then takes a large roll of adhesive tape and puts that into his pants pocket. Neff's hand places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She closes the sack shut. He halts as a brief, stocky woman, pushing a youngster in a walker, comes into view and nears. She pauses beside Neff, who is pretending to scan a label on a tin. Phyllis puts a few bars of soap into her basket. She nods. Neff reaches a tin down from the high ledge and hands it to her. She moves away with her coffee and her child. Out of the corner of his eye, Neff observes her leave. He moves nearer to Phyllis again. He departs. She gazes after him. He is wearing a light grey suit and has his hat on. He is standing behind his desk unsealing some mail, taking a few documents out of his briefcase, verifying something in his rate book, making a quick telephone call. Keyes enters with some documents in his hand. The telephone rings on Neff's desk. Automatically Keyes seizes the phone and replies. Neff picks the phone up and replies. Phyllis is on the phone. Neff on the phone. His eye catches Keyes', who is pacing up and down. He speaks into the phone as serenely as possible. Neff on phone. He covers the receiver with his hand and turns to Keyes, who is now standing at the window. He makes a gesture as if anticipating Keyes to leave. Keyes stays right where he is. Neff looks at Keyes' back with a strained expression, then lifts the phone again. Neff on the phone. Neff gets up from his desk. He punches his abdomen with his fist. Keyes nods slowly, a little sad and a little ashamed. He departs. Neff is alone. He observes the door close, then turns and goes slowly to the water dispenser. He fills a paper cup and stands holding it. His thoughts are somewhere else. After a moment, he absently throws the cupful of water into the receptacle under the dispenser. He goes back to the desk. He takes his rate book out of his briefcase and puts it on the desk. He leaves the office, with his briefcase under his arm. Neff's coupe comes down the street and swings into the garage and goes down the ramp into the basement. There are about eight automobiles parked. A colored attendant in coveralls and rubber boots is cleaning a car with a hose and sponge. Neff's automobile comes into the shot and halts near the attendant. Neff exits with his briefcase under his arm. He is folding a hand towel and stuffing it into his jacket pocket. He then takes a large roll of adhesive tape and puts that into his pants pocket. Neff's hand places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The bag is snapped shut by her. He is interrupted by a short, squatty woman pushing a child in a walker, who comes into sight and approaches. Beside Neff, who is pretending to read a label on a can, she stops. A few cakes of soap are put into her basket by Phyllis. She nods. A can is reached down by Neff from the high shelf and handed to her. With her coffee and her child, she moves away. She is watched by Neff out of the corner of his eye as she goes. Phyllis is approached again by him. He leaves. After him, she stares. A light grey suit is worn by him and a hat is on his head. Behind his desk, he stands, opening some mail, taking a few papers out of his briefcase, checking something in his rate book, and making a quick telephone call. Papers in hand, Keyes enters. The phone rings on the desk of Neff. Automatically, the phone is grabbed and answered by Keyes. The phone is picked up and answered by Neff. Phyllis is on the phone. Neff is on the phone. His eye catches Keyes’ eye, who is walking up and down. Into the phone, he speaks as calmly as possible. Neff is on the phone. The receiver is covered by him with his hand and Keyes, who is now standing at the window, is turned to. A gesture is made by him as if expecting Keyes to leave. Right where he is, Keyes stays. Neff looks at the back of Keyes with a strained expression, then the phone is lifted again by him. Neff is on the phone. From his desk, Neff gets up. His stomach is punched with his fist. Slowly, a little sad and a little ashamed, Keyes nods. He leaves. Alone, Neff is. The door is watched by him close, then he turns and goes slowly to the water cooler. A paper cup is filled and held by him. His thoughts are somewhere else. After a moment, the cupful of water is absently thrown by him into the receptacle under the cooler. Back to the desk, he goes. His rate book is taken out of his briefcase and put on the desk by him. The office is left by him, with his briefcase under his arm. Down the street comes Neff’s coupe and into the garage, it swings and goes down the ramp into the basement. About eight cars are parked. A colored attendant in coveralls and rubber boots washes a car with a hose and sponge. Into the shot comes Neff’s car and near the attendant, it stops. With his briefcase under his arm, Neff gets out. A hand towel is folded by him and stuffed into his jacket pocket. Then, a large roll of adhesive tape is taken and put into his pants pocket by him. A small card is placed by Neff’s hand against the bell clapper in each of these.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She closes the bag. A short, stocky woman pushing a child in a walker approaches Neff, who pretends to read a label. Phyllis adds soap to her basket. Neff hands her a can from a high shelf. She leaves with her coffee and child. Neff watches her, then moves closer to Phyllis. He leaves, wearing a light grey suit and hat. At his desk, he opens mail, takes papers from his briefcase, checks his rate book, and makes a phone call. Keyes enters with papers. The phone rings, Keyes answers, as does Neff—it's Phyllis. Neff speaks calmly while catching Keyes’ eye. He gestures for Keyes to leave, but Keyes remains. Neff looks strained, covers the receiver, and faces Keyes at the window. Neff stands, punches his stomach, and Keyes leaves, nodding slowly and sadly. Alone, Neff goes to the water cooler, fills a cup, and throws the water away. Back at his desk, he retrieves his rate book from the briefcase and leaves the office with it under his arm. His coupe drives into a garage and parks in the basement, among eight cars. An attendant washes a car. Neff exits with his briefcase, stuffs a hand towel in his pocket, and pockets adhesive tape. He places a small card against the bell clapper.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She closes her bag as a short woman pushing a child in a walker approaches. Pausing next to Neff, who pretends to read a can label, Phyllis adds soap to her basket. Neff hands her a can from a high shelf. She leaves with her coffee and child as Neff watches. He approaches Phyllis again, then leaves. She watches his retreat. Wearing a light grey suit and hat, Neff stands behind his desk, opens mail, checks his rate book, and makes a call. Keyes enters with papers. Neff's phone rings; he and Keyes answer. Phyllis is on the line. Neff's eyes meet Keyes', who paces. Neff speaks calmly on the phone, gestures for Keyes to leave, but Keyes stays. Neff, visibly strained, covers the receiver, turns to Keyes at the window. Neff punches his stomach, Keyes nods sadly and exits. Alone, Neff watches the door, goes to the water cooler, fills a cup, and discards the water. He returns to his desk, retrieves his rate book from his briefcase, and exits the office. Neff's coupe enters a garage, parking in the basement. A colored attendant washes a car nearby. Neff exits his car with his briefcase, stows a hand towel in his pocket, a roll of adhesive tape in his pants. Neff places a card against each bell clapper.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
With a decisive motion, she snaps the bag shut, ensuring everything is secured tightly inside. Meanwhile, he suddenly breaks off his conversation as a short, stout woman comes into view. She is pushing a child in a walker as she approaches their position. The woman halts right next to Neff, who is pretending to be engrossed in reading the label on a can. Phyllis nonchalantly places a few cakes of soap into her basket, offering a slight nod. Neff reaches up to take a can from the high shelf and graciously hands it to her. With that, she moves away, carrying her coffee and guiding her child along. Neff discreetly observes her departure out of the corner of his eye before drawing closer to Phyllis once more. Eventually, he leaves, and she watches him with intent. 

Dressed in a light grey suit, with his hat perched on his head, Neff is back at the office. He stands behind his desk, engaged in the task of opening some mail. He methodically takes a few papers out of his briefcase, reviewing them with practiced ease, and checks something in his rate book. Completing these tasks, he makes a quick, efficient telephone call. At this moment, Keyes enters, holding a stack of papers. The telephone rings on Neff's desk, and, without hesitation, Keyes instinctively picks up the phone to answer it. Neff then picks up his own phone and answers as well. It's Phyllis on the line. Neff speaks into the phone with as much calmness as he can muster, while his eyes catch sight of Keyes, who is pacing back and forth restlessly. Neff covers the phone's receiver with his hand and turns to Keyes, now standing near the window. He gestures subtly, implying that he expects Keyes to leave the office. Nevertheless, Keyes remains steadfast, right in his place. Neff gazes at Keyes' back with a strained look, then lifts the phone again, resuming his conversation with Phyllis.

With the phone call concluded, Neff rises from his desk and punches his stomach with his fist in a sign of frustration. Keyes observes this, nodding slowly with a mixture of sadness and a hint of shame. He exits, leaving Neff alone in the office. Watching the door close behind Keyes, Neff turns and walks slowly toward the water cooler. He fills a paper cup with water and stands there, holding it absentmindedly as his thoughts drift elsewhere. Moments later, he absentmindedly tosses the cupful of water into the receptacle beneath the cooler. Returning to his desk, he takes his rate book out of his briefcase and places it on the desk, preparing to leave the office, briefcase in tow. 

Neff's coupe makes its way down the street, smoothly turning into the garage and descending the ramp into the basement. In the basement, about eight cars are parked. A colored attendant, clad in coveralls and rubber boots, is busy washing a car with a hose and sponge. Neff's car enters the shot and halts near the attendant. Exiting the vehicle, he carries his briefcase under his arm while neatly folding a hand towel and tucking it into his jacket pocket. With meticulous care, he then retrieves a large roll of adhesive tape and slips it into his pants pocket. Neff's hand then places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these, ensuring everything is just as he intends.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
With a decisive and purposeful motion, she efficiently snaps the bag shut, making sure that everything is securely and tightly packed inside. At that very moment, he abruptly breaks off his conversation as a short, stout woman unexpectedly comes into view. She approaches their position while pushing a child nestled comfortably in a walker. The woman pauses right next to Neff, who is pretending to be deeply engrossed in reading the label on a can. Meanwhile, Phyllis casually places a few small cakes of soap into her basket, acknowledging him with a slight nod. Neff then reaches up to grab a can from the high shelf and graciously hands it over to her. With that, she moves away, carrying her coffee and coaxing her child along with care. Neff discreetly observes her departure out of the corner of his eye before drawing closer to Phyllis once more. Eventually, he leaves, and she watches his exit with focused intent.

Dressed impeccably in a light grey suit, with his hat perched neatly on his head, Neff finds himself back at the office. He stands behind his desk, fully engaged in the task of opening some mail. With methodical precision, he takes a few papers out of his briefcase, reviewing them with a practiced and easy familiarity, then checks something in his rate book. Upon completing these tasks, he makes a quick and efficient telephone call. It is at this moment that Keyes enters the room, holding a sizable stack of papers. The telephone on Neff's desk rings, and Keyes instinctively picks it up to answer it without hesitation. Neff then picks up his own phone and answers as well. It's Phyllis on the line, and Neff speaks into the phone with as much calmness as he can muster, all the while his eyes catching sight of Keyes, who paces back and forth restlessly. Neff covers the phone's receiver with his hand and turns to face Keyes, now standing near the window. He gestures subtly, implying that he expects Keyes to take his leave from the office. Nevertheless, Keyes remains steadfast, holding his ground. Neff gazes at Keyes' back with a strained and intense look, then lifts the phone again, resuming his conversation with Phyllis.

With the phone call concluded, Neff rises from his desk, frustrated, and punches his stomach with his fist as an expression of his irritation. Keyes observes this display, nodding slowly with a mixture of sadness and a subtle hint of shame. He exits, leaving Neff alone in the office. Watching the door close behind Keyes, Neff turns around and walks slowly toward the water cooler. He fills a paper cup with water and stands there, holding it absentmindedly as his thoughts drift elsewhere. Moments later, he tosses the cupful of water into the receptacle beneath the cooler, still lost in thought. Returning to his desk, he takes his rate book out of his briefcase and places it on the desk, preparing to leave the office with the briefcase in tow.

Neff's sleek coupe makes its way down the street, smoothly turning into the garage and descending the ramp into the basement level. In the basement, about eight cars are parked in an orderly fashion. A colored attendant, clad in coveralls and rubber boots, is diligently washing a car with a hose and sponge. Neff's car enters the shot and comes to a halt near the attendant. Exiting the vehicle, he carries his briefcase under his arm while neatly folding a hand towel and tucking it into his jacket pocket. With meticulous care and precision, he then retrieves a large roll of adhesive tape and slips it into his pants pocket. Neff's hand then places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these, taking a moment to ensure that everything is just as he intends, satisfied with the arrangement.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She snaps the bag shut with a decisive motion, ensuring the contents are securely enclosed. He abruptly halts his previous action as a short, squatty woman, who is gently pushing a child in a walker, gradually comes into view and steadily approaches their location. She stops beside Neff, who is engaged in the act of pretending to read a label on a can, holding it up as if scrutinizing its details. Meanwhile, Phyllis casually places a few cakes of soap into her shopping basket, completing her selection with a subtle nod to herself. Neff stretches slightly to reach a can from the high shelf above and extends his arm to hand it to her, making it easier for her to add to her collection. With a slight shift, she moves away, her attention divided between her coffee and her child in the walker. Out of the corner of his eye, Neff watches her as she distances herself from him. He subtly moves closer to Phyllis again, attempting to maintain their proximity before departing. She fixes her gaze on him as he leaves, taking in his appearance, noting that he is dressed in a light grey suit and has his hat securely positioned on his head. Transitioning to another scene, he stands behind his desk, methodically opening some mail with a practiced hand. He retrieves a few papers from his briefcase, examining them briefly before placing them down. He refers to his rate book, flipping through its pages to check a specific detail, and then makes a quick telephone call, his actions efficient and routine. Keyes enters the room holding some papers in his hand, his presence noticeable. As the telephone rings on Neff's desk, Keyes instinctively grabs the phone, responding with a practiced ease. Neff simultaneously picks up the phone and responds as well, participating in a simultaneous exchange. Phyllis is on the other end of the line, speaking to Neff, who maintains his composure and speaks into the phone as calmly as possible, despite the underlying tension. Neff, still on the phone, catches Keyes' eye as he paces the room. Neff covers the receiver with his hand and turns to face Keyes, who is now standing by the window, absorbed in his own thoughts. Neff gestures towards Keyes, subtly implying that he expects him to leave. Surprisingly, Keyes remains rooted to the spot, unwavering. Neff looks at the back of Keyes with a strained expression, then lifts the phone again to continue his conversation. As he remains on the phone, Neff eventually gets up from his desk, feeling the need to move, and gives his stomach an encouraging punch with his fist, as if bracing himself for what is to come. Keyes nods slowly in response, a mixture of sadness and shame evident in his demeanor as he exits the room, leaving Neff alone. Neff watches the door close, the finality of it resonating with him, and then turns to make his way slowly to the water cooler. He fills a paper cup with water, holding it absentmindedly as his thoughts drift elsewhere. After a moment of contemplation, he throws the cupful of water into the receptacle beneath the cooler without drinking it. Returning to his desk, he takes his rate book out of his briefcase once more and places it deliberately on the desk. He then leaves the office, his briefcase tucked securely under his arm, ready for his next endeavor. Neff's coupe emerges, driving down the street before skillfully swinging into the garage and descending the ramp into the basement. Within the garage, approximately eight cars are parked in neat rows. A colored attendant, clad in coveralls and wearing rubber boots, is diligently washing a car with a hose and sponge, his movements rhythmic and precise. Neff's car comes into view and halts near the attendant. Stepping out of the vehicle, Neff carries his briefcase with him, tucked snugly under his arm. He unfolds a hand towel, neatly folding it before stuffing it into his jacket pocket for future use. He then takes a large roll of adhesive tape and tucks it into his pants pocket, ensuring it is concealed from view. Finally, Neff's hand carefully places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these, completing his series of actions with precision.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She snaps the bag shut, and a short, squatty woman pushing a child in a walker approaches. Pretending to read a label, Neff discreetly assists her by handing down a can from a high shelf. As she moves away, Neff keeps her in his peripheral vision before shifting his focus back to Phyllis and eventually leaving. Later, dressed in a light grey suit and hat, Neff stands behind his desk, multitasking by sorting mail, reviewing papers, consulting his rate book, and making a quick call. Keyes enters, papers in hand, just as the phone rings. Keyes instinctively answers, but Neff takes over the call, maintaining composure while subtly signaling Keyes to leave. Keyes remains, prompting a strained look from Neff, who resumes his phone conversation. After Keyes departs with a nod, Neff, now alone, reflects momentarily by the water cooler before absently discarding the water. Returning to his desk, he retrieves his rate book and exits the office with his briefcase. Neff drives his coupe into a garage, parking near an attendant washing a car. Exiting the vehicle, Neff tucks a hand towel into his jacket and a roll of adhesive tape into his pants pocket before discreetly placing a small card against a bell clapper.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She snaps the bag shut, ensuring everything is securely stored. He breaks off as a short, squatty woman, a familiar face in the neighborhood known for her friendliness, pushing a child in a walker popular for its safety features, comes into sight and approaches. She stops beside Neff, who is pretending to read a label on a can of tomatoes, a staple in many cuisines. Phyllis puts a few cakes of soap into her basket, opting for a brand known for its eco-friendly packaging. She nods. Neff reaches a can down from the high shelf, which is stocked with imported goods, and hands it to her. She moves away with her coffee, a popular local roast, and her child. Out of the corner of his eye Neff watches her go. He moves closer to Phyllis again. He goes off. She stares after him, curious about his hurried demeanor. He is wearing a light grey suit, tailored for business professionals, and has his hat on, a style reminiscent of mid-20th century fashion. He is standing behind his desk, a vintage mahogany piece, opening some mail, taking a few papers out of his briefcase, checking something in his rate book, a crucial tool for insurance calculations, making a quick telephone call. Keyes enters with some papers in his hand, looking for Neff's opinion. The telephone rings on Neff's desk. Automatically Keyes grabs the phone and answers with practiced efficiency. Neff picks the phone up and answers. Phyllis is on the phone, sounding slightly anxious. Neff on the phone. His eye catches Keyes', who is walking up and down, pacing like he does when deep in thought. He speaks into the phone as calmly as possible. Neff on phone. He covers the receiver with his hand and turns to Keyes, who is now standing at the window, staring at the bustling city below. He makes a gesture as if expecting Keyes to leave. Keyes stays right where he is. Neff looks at Keyes' back with a strained expression, then lifts the phone again. Neff on the phone. Neff gets up from his desk. He punches his stomach with his fist, a habit when frustrated. Keyes nods slowly, a little sad and a little ashamed, as if understanding a deeper issue. He goes out. Neff is alone. He watches the door close, then turns and goes slowly to the water cooler, a model known for its efficient cooling. He fills a paper cup and stands holding it. His thoughts are somewhere else, likely on the phone call. After a moment he absently throws the cupful of water into the receptacle under the cooler. He goes back to the desk. He takes his rate book out of his briefcase and puts it on the desk. He leaves the office, with his briefcase under his arm, ready for another day. Neff's coupe, a sleek 1940s model prized for its craftsmanship, comes down the street and swings into the garage, expertly designed with ample parking space, and goes down the ramp into the basement. There are about eight cars parked, a typical sight at peak business hours. A colored attendant in coveralls and rubber boots, working tirelessly, is washing a car with a hose and sponge. Neff's car comes into the shot and stops near the attendant. Neff gets out with his briefcase under his arm. He is folding a hand towel and stuffing it into his jacket pocket, ensuring he looks tidy. He then takes a large roll of adhesive tape, often used for quick repairs, and puts that into his pants pocket. Neff's hand places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these, a clever trick for subtlety.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. He leaves the office with his briefcase under his arm. Neff's coupe comes down the street and swings into the garage and goes down the ramp into the basement. There are about eight cars parked. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. He makes a gesture as if expecting Keyes to leave. Keyes stays right where he is. Neff looks at Keyes' back with a strained expression then lifts the phone again. Neff on the phone. Neff gets up from his desk. He punches his stomach with his fist. Keyes nods slowly a little sad and a little ashamed. He goes out. Neff is alone. He watches the door close then turns and goes slowly to the water cooler. He fills a paper cup and stands holding it. His thoughts are somewhere else. After a moment he absently throws the cupful of water into the receptacle under the cooler. He goes back to the desk. He takes his rate book out of his brief case and puts it on the desk. He leaves the office with his briefcase under his arm. Neff's coupe comes down the street and swings into the garage and goes down the ramp into the basement. There are about eight cars parked. A colored attendant in coveralls and rubber boots is washing a car with a hose and sponge. Neff's car comes into the shot and stops near the attendant. Neff gets out with his briefcase under his arm. He is folding a hand towel and stuffing it into his jacket pocket. He then takes a large roll of adhesive tape and puts that into his pants pocket. Neff's hand places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: She snaps the bag shut. He breaks off as a short squatty woman pushing a child in a walker comes into sight and approaches. She stops beside Neff who is pretending to read a label on a can. Phyllis puts a few cakes of soap into her basket. She nods. Neff reaches a can down from the high shelf and hands it to her. She moves away with her coffee and her child. Out of the corner of his eye Neff watches her go. He moves closer to Phyllis again. He goes off. She stares after him. He is wearing a light grey suit and has his hat on. After a moment he absently throws the cupful of water into the receptacle under the cooler. He goes back to the desk. He takes his rate book out of his brief case and puts it on the desk. He leaves the office with his briefcase under his arm. Neff's coupe comes down the street and swings into the garage and goes down the ramp into the basement. There are about eight cars parked. A colored attendant in coveralls and rubber boots is washing a car with a hose and sponge. Neff's car comes into the shot and stops near the attendant. Neff gets out with his briefcase under his arm. He is folding a hand towel and stuffing it into his jacket pocket. He then takes a large roll of adhesive tape and puts that into his pants pocket. Neff's hand places a small card against the bell clapper in each of these.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She *zips* the *folder* shut. He *pauses* as a tall, lanky man, *pulling* a cat in a stroller, *comes* into view and *wanders over*. He *pauses* next to Marcy, who is *pretending* to *browse* a postcard on a shelf. Bernard *puts* a few *chips* of cheese into his cart. He *waves*. Marcy *grabs* a postcard down from the *low rack* and *passes* it to him. He *wanders off* with his tea and his cat. Out of the corner of her eye, Marcy *notices* him *leaving*. She *edges closer* to Bernard again. She *departs*. He *glares* after her. She is *dressed* in a dark green dress and has her scarf on. She is *sitting* in a booth *sorting* some letters, *pulling* a few *photos* out of her handbag, *reviewing* something in her cookbook, *making* a quick note. Linda *arrives* with some catalogs in her bag. The cellphone *buzzes* on Marcy's table. Instinctively Linda *grabs* the cellphone and *responds*. Marcy *picks* the cellphone up and *responds*. Bernard is on the cellphone. Marcy on the cellphone. Her eye *meets* Linda's, who is *pacing* up and down. He *talks* into the cellphone as quietly as possible. Marcy on cellphone. She *covers* the microphone with her hand and *turns to* Linda, who is now *sitting* at the counter. She *makes* a gesture as if *expecting* Linda to *stand*. Linda *remains* right where she is. Marcy *watches* Linda's feet with a *tense expression*, then *raises* the cellphone again. Marcy on the cellphone. Marcy *rises* from her booth. She *prods* her shoulder with her elbow. Linda *smiles* slowly, a little happy and a little *embarrassed*. She *leaves*. Marcy is alone. She *notices* the curtain *close*, then *turns* and *ambles* slowly to the vending machine. She *pour* a paper cup and *stands* holding it. Her thoughts are somewhere else. After a moment she *idly* *tosses* the cupful of juice into the recycling bin under the machine. She *returns* to the booth. She *takes* her cookbook out of her handbag and *places* it on the table. She *leaves* the cafe, with her handbag under her arm. Marcy's bicycle *rolls* down the path and *glides* into the shed and *coasts* down the ramp into the basement. There are about eight bicycles *lined up*. A young mechanic in overalls and rain boots is *tuning* a bicycle with a wrench and rag. Marcy's bicycle *comes* into the *frame* and *halts* near the mechanic. Marcy *climbs off* with her handbag under her arm. She is *folding* a washcloth and *tucking* it into her shirt pocket. She then *retrieves* a small roll of string and *places* that into her coat pocket. Marcy's hand *affixes* a tiny sticker against the bell hammer in each of these.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Phyllis approaches Neff, pretending to read a can label. After a brief interaction, Neff resumes his work, wearing a grey suit and handling tasks at his desk. Keyes enters, and as the phone rings, Keyes answers it but Neff takes the call. Phyllis is on the line; Neff tries to speak calmly while Keyes stays nearby. Neff gestures for Keyes to leave, but he remains. Neff punches his stomach in frustration, and Keyes exits, slightly ashamed. Alone, Neff fills a cup at the water cooler, lost in thought, then discards the water. He prepares his briefcase, leaves the office, and drives to a garage. An attendant is washing cars as Neff parks, carrying his briefcase. Neff places a small card near the bell clapper before leaving.
